titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that executives of the bankrupt firm MF Global should not be rewarded with bonuses while customer money is still missing.
A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that executives of the bankrupt firm MF Global should not be rewarded with bonuses while customer money is still missing.

vote.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of the Senate that, until the segregated account funds of its customers have been fully repaid and federal investigations have revealed both the cause of, and parties responsible for, the loss of millions of dollars of its customers' money, bonuses should not be paid to the executives and employees responsible for the day-to-day management and operations of MF Global.
